item.title: Aryna Sabalenka defends 'Battle of the Sexes' exhibition, wants to play Nick Kyrgios again
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka does not want her "Battle of the Sexes" clash with Nick Kyrgios to be the last and insists exhibitions have a vital role to play in tennis.

item.title: WA police searching for snorkeller missing off Ledge Point Beach, north of Perth
item.description: Authorities step up their search for a 32-year-old snorkeller missing since yesterday afternoon in the ocean off Ledge Point Beach, north of Perth, after he disappeared while diving for crayfish.

item.title: Nation's largest employer bodies throw support behind royal commission into Bondi Beach terror attack
item.description: Former Reserve Bank governors and CEOs are among more than 130 business leaders and prominent Australians calling for a Commonwealth royal commission in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

item.title: Russia says 20 killed in Ukrainian strike in occupied Kherson region
item.description: It comes as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russia is bringing the conflict "into the new year" with a barrage of drone strikes on the country's energy infrastructure.

item.title: Sydney and Melbourne property markets go backwards as national values hit speed bump
item.description: The red-hot Australian housing market is showing the first signs of easing since interest rates started rising in May 2022.

item.title: Walking with Moai: Unlocking the mysteries of Easter Island stone statues
item.description: A study using 11,600 aerial drone photos to map a mountainous quarry in 3D reveals more about how the island's famed stone sentinels were created and moved to their final resting places.

item.title: Focus apps claim to improve your productivity. Do they actually work?
item.description: To understand whether these apps are worth our while, we first need to consider why staying focused is so difficult in the first place.

item.title: Two MPs, two legal cases and one region left bewildered
item.description: The lower house of South Australia's parliament has two representatives from the Limestone Coast. Both are now in custody.

item.title: South Australian emergency services kept busy as hot weather causes trees to drop limbs
item.description: Hot weather has caused stressed trees to drop limbs, damaging property across South Australia and injuring one person so far this summer.

item.title: Major retrospective of ceramic artist Pippin Drysdale opens in Perth
item.description: The first retrospective of the ceramic artist's work has gone on show in Perth at the state gallery, telling the story of an extraordinary career.

item.title: Artist Piiij Goodrem used honest self-portraits and therapy to heal from childhood trauma
item.description: The process of creating detailed self-portraits, inspired by tropical landscapes, helped Piiij Goodrem deal with past trauma and addiction.

item.title: Could modular and prefabricated homes be the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?
item.description: Fast to build, eco-friendly and affordable: modular and pre-fabricated homes have been touted as a possible solution to Australia's housing crisis, but manufacturers and suppliers say changes are needed to reduce costs and meet demand.

item.title: Usman Khawaja takes aim at 'racial stereotypes' during retirement announcement ahead of fifth Ashes Test
item.description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja takes aim at his critics one last time as he announces his retirement from international cricket.

item.title: Unique whale behaviour attracts intrigued visitors to regional Queensland
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Unique 'mugging' behaviour attracts intrigued whale watchers to Queensland hotspot
item.description: People normally try to avoid getting mugged, but when it comes to being mugged by humpback whales, sightseers are travelling to Queensland's whale-watching capital to witness this special event.

item.title: As Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's mayor, what are his chances of success?
item.description: New York's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has vowed not to water down his ambitious agenda during an impassioned inauguration address outside City Hall. But is his vision achievable?

item.title: Zohran Mamdani vows to protect people of NYC at swearing-in ceremony
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Usman Khawaja did it all his own way and retires a modern day Australian cricket great
item.description: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

item.title: Tennant Creek mother who died in police watch house described as well-respected and bubbly
item.description: A remote outback town is searching for answers about why a “respectful, friendly and bubbly” Aboriginal mother died in the police watch house, more than 24 hours after her Christmas Day arrest.

item.title: Lachie Neale steps down as Brisbane Lions co-captain
item.description: The club said the 32-year-old had made the decision following a "challenging personal period".

item.title: China's beef tariffs aren't personal as economy slows
item.description: Beijing's new measures are aimed at trying to rein in an Australian surge and manage local growth, rather than a direct target on Australia.

item.title: Research ties China's smog clean-up to hotter and drier conditions in Australia
item.description: As China caps off a historic clean-up of its smog and air pollution, the clearer air is helping temperatures rise to new records. Now, researchers are linking that change to hotter and drier conditions in Australia.

item.title: Alleged bikie granted bail after 'calculated hit' inside Queanbeyan hair salon
item.description: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.

item.title: Venus Williams to become oldest ever Australian Open participant after receiving wildcard
item.description: Venus Williams will play in the main draw of the Australian Open for the first time since 2021, 28 years after she first graced Melbourne Park.

item.title: Man faces court after alleged crime spree, police pursuit in Latrobe Valley
item.description: A 34-year-old man has been remanded in custody after allegedly going on a multi-day crime spree across Victoria's south-east involving carjackings, burglaries and a police pursuit.

item.title: Man who kidnapped boy from Moora home given eight-year prison sentence
item.description: A man who abducted a boy from his bed in regional WA after sniffing butane and having delusions about aliens is sentenced to eight years in prison.

item.title: Boddington family watches heritage cottage filled with antiques go up in flames on Christmas Day
item.description: Two heritage homes and thousands of hectares of land were lost in a Christmas Day bushfire in Boddington.

item.title: Donald Trump gave a wide-ranging interview about his health. Here's what we learned
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

item.title: Todd Murphy in line for Ashes return as SCG curator allays fears over pitch's green exterior
item.description: Todd Murphy could play his first Test match on Australian soil as the curator of the SCG allays fears over the pitch.

item.title: Maya Joint hit with illness ahead of Australia's United Cup opener against Norway
item.description: Australia's teen sensation is forced to lay low, with team captain Lleyton Hewitt hoping it is just a 24-hour thing.

item.title: Mother wallaby death sparks animal cruelty investigation in far north Queensland
item.description: Wildlife carers have lodged formal complaints with police and environment officials after stumbling across a scene involving a dead mother wallaby tied to a signpost.

item.title: China-Taiwan-US triangle held together by assumptions and one dangerous lie
item.description: The US has no intention of abandoning Taiwan. But it also has no intention of binding itself to an automatic war commitment on a timeline it does not control.

item.title: Albanese government can expect economic and political pressure in 2026
item.description: What are you watching in Australian politics in 2026? That's the question we put to the ABC's political journalists and columnists.

item.title: Are reading goals helpful or performative? How to read more in the new year
item.description: While some people might find goal setting motivating — such as reading X number of books each year or pages each day — there is a risk of turning what is supposed to be a pleasurable activity into a chore.

item.title: Today in History, January 3: Steve Waugh secures a last-ball century to complete his perfect day
item.description: With one ball remaining on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in 2003, Steve Waugh stared down a century and his own cricketing mortality before securing one of the most famous centuries of his storied career.

item.title: World-first as Australian donates organs after self-administering assisted dying medication
item.description: An Australian woman is believed to have become the first person in the world to donate organs after self-administering oral voluntary assisted dying medication.

item.title: Red and yellow flags can be dangerously confusing. Is it time to change them?
item.description: Every summer, millions of Australians head to the beach and every year thousands are rescued by lifeguards or surf life savers, and even surfers or other bystanders.

item.title: Anastasia Golubeva set for 2026 Winter Olympics debut with Australia after citizenship change
item.description: Figure skater Anastasia Golubeva becomes an Australian citizen, just six weeks out from the Milano-Cortina Olympics.

item.title: The moon will loom extra large tonight — but it's not a supermoon
item.description: Stargazers will be treated with a supersized wolf moon for the first weekend of the year. Here's what to know.

item.title: The parts of Myanmar the military junta doesn't want you to see
item.description: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

item.title: Flooded outback Queensland graziers to get $2m government package for fodder drops
item.description: Floodwaters remain in outback Queensland as graziers start to tally up livestock losses. Major flooding is possible in the north-west, with king tides forecast on the east coast.

item.title: FBI says it thwarted ISIS-inspired New Year's Eve attack in North Carolina
item.description: The US Attorney for the Western District of North Carolina claims the 18-year-old suspect had planned to attack a grocery store and fast food restaurant in his hometown.

item.title: Mid North Coast brumby program rehomes 160 wild horses across Australia
item.description: About a third of the brumby population on the NSW Mid North Coast has been rehomed through a program designed to give wild horses a second chance as pets.

item.title: Naomi Osaka loses United Cup match to Maria Sakkari ahead of Australian Open
item.description: Just over two weeks from the season-opening major, former world number one Naomi Osaka reveals she is not at full health after contracting a viral illness over the Christmas period.

item.title: Tesla loses title of bestselling EV company to BYD as sales drop
item.description: Tesla sales have declined for the second consecutive year, with Chinese rival BYD surpassing it as the world's largest electric vehicle maker.

item.title: Police hunt for offenders after shooting in Melbourne's inner north
item.description: Police are searching for offenders, who are believed to have driven past in a silver SUV and fired shots at a young man, before fleeing the scene.

item.title: Barbecue explosion prompts safety warning after Qld beautician's burns
item.description: Rachel Dear has a serious warning for anyone using a gas barbecue after she suffered significant face and body burns while cooking on Christmas Eve.

item.title: Coffee pods generate thousands of tonnes of waste in Australia. Here's what is being done about it
item.description: Between 10 and 20 per cent of the 3 million coffee pods Australians consume daily are actually recycled. Here's what's being done to change that.

item.title: Photographs of Men in Love exhibition reveals public glimpses of forbidden love
item.description: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

item.title: Helen Burnet has defected from the Greens but voters may still be wondering exactly why
item.description: Helen Burnet fronted the cameras on Friday to announce she was quitting the party she's been a member of for more than 20 years, but it's still not clear exactly why she's made the move.

item.title: WA's Pilbara region shares a human and shorebird FIFO population
item.description: Dozens of shorebird species flock to northern WA for summer during their global migration.

item.title: Middle Percy Island is a 'haven' for sailors, displaying scores of memorabilia from bygone days
item.description: Middle Percy Island is a rare gem where boaties can come ashore and wander through thousands of mementos left by travellers from across the globe.

item.title: Former Darwin councillor's ex-partner speaks out after guilty domestic violence verdict
item.description: Former Darwin councillor Paul Arnold was found guilty of domestic violence after a years-long court battle, with his ex-partner refusing to be scared into silence. She said the case was "stressful and deeply humiliating", but facing her abuser had been empowering.

item.title: Storm chaser captures rare red sprites across Kimberley sky
item.description: A storm chaser says he "screamed" when he captured an elusive natural phenomenon, known as red sprites, on video.

item.title: NSW Police riot squad to carry long-arm firearms at Sydney Ashes series following Bondi attack
item.description: Officers will carry long-arm firearms as part of a bolstered police presence at the Ashes series in Sydney in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Premium beef producers expect to be the main casualty of China's new 55 per cent tariff
item.description: Australian cattle farmers producing wagyu and Angus beef are likely to be among the hardest hit by China's 55 per cent tariff on exports exceeding a 205,000-tonne quota.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Wildlife carers warn people to watch out for puggle burrows this summer
item.description: With female echidnas seemingly creating burrows in random places at this time of the year, wildlife carers warn to keep an eye out for what might be disturbed while doing holiday work on your property.

item.title: Local government inspector Tony Brown granted new powers to probe WA councils and 'improve accountability'
item.description: The new role of Western Australia local government inspector Tony Brown includes the ability to send in monitors — as well as legal and financial experts — to stamp out any early signs of trouble.

item.title: Driver arrested for allegedly speeding at 209km/h on Southern Expressway
item.description: Police say two 19-year-old drivers will face court for street racing along Adelaide's Southern Expressway, with one of the P-platers allegedly detected speeding at 209km/h.

item.title: Australia coy about Cameron Green's role in final Ashes Test against England at SCG
item.description: Steve Smith launches an impassioned defence of the out-of-form Cameron Green, but cannot guarantee the all-rounder's place in Australia's XI for the final Ashes Test.

item.title: Hunt for escaped red-whiskered bulbul that has SA's fruitgrowers worried
item.description: The sighting of a single red-whiskered bulbul in the wild might not seem like a big deal, but this invasive pest could put crops and the environment at risk.

item.description: Police arrest a 61-year-old man after a seven-day investigation involving CCTV, crime scene analysis, forensic examination and witness enquiries.

item.title: Pakistan court sentences journalists to life in prison over links to 2023 protests after Imran Khan's arrest
item.description: Eight journalists and social media commentators are sentenced to life imprisonment in Pakistan after being convicted of terrorism-related offences linked to online activity in support of jailed former prime minister Imran Khan.

item.title: NSW Police investigating woman's death at Goulburn home
item.description: NSW Police launch an investigation after an unidentified woman was found dead in a home in Goulburn on Saturday morning.

item.description: Police are investigating an altercation potentially involving edged weapons after a collision on the Monash Freeway in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios prepared to go through Australian Open qualifying if wildcard spot eludes him
item.description: Nick Kyrgios describes himself as a "chaotic mess, but an entertainer" as he prepares to return in Brisbane and awaits a call on his Australian Open status.

item.title: For its 250th birthday, America is being America
item.description: It is entirely fitting that the US is so splintered on its semiquincentennial. Division, for the lion's share of its history, has been its default.

item.description: You might have a personal preference for which spread you use at home, but experts say there are health considerations for which one you use.

item.description: Four Hindu men have been killed in Muslim-majority Bangladesh in just over two weeks, and several houses have been burned, leaving the minority community traumatised and fearing for their lives.

item.description: The US will temporarily run Venezuela after American forces captured the country's president and first lady in an extraordinary military strike, US President Donald Trump says.

item.description: Tourists are stranded in towns dotted across north-west Queensland as rain continues to keep major rivers in flood.

item.title: Man who failed to remove backyard cheese facility told to pay $120,000
item.description: An Adelaide retiree who continually ignored orders to remove an unauthorised backyard cheesemaking facility from his suburban home is ordered to pay more than $120,000 in costs, after being found guilty of contempt of court.

item.title: Calls for universal vision screening tests for all SA preschool children
item.description: A group of researchers is calling on the South Australian government to implement a universal vision screening program for all children attending preschools or day care centres.

item.description: As the Tumbarumba Rodeo celebrates its 80th year, the Rial family have held on for the longest ride of them all.

item.title: How Louis Braille’s musical notation system remains relevant 200 years after its invention
item.description: In the 1820s, Louis Braille devised a raised-dot system of letters, numbers and musical notation. 200 years later, it’s still opening the music world for blind musicians.

item.title: Man arrested at Sydney airport after alleged sexual assault in Melbourne laneway on New Year's Day
item.description: A 22-year-old French man has been arrested at Sydney International Airport following an alleged sexual assault in Melbourne's CBD in the early hours of New Year's Day.

item.description: Oliver Foran struggled with his mental health after losing his mother to cancer. Now, he is training to set a world record while raising money and awareness for youth mental health.

item.description: Donning a helmet and a well-equipped harness, Dr Fernanda Alves looks like she is set to take on an extreme sport. Instead, she is climbing trees to check nesting boxes for a tiny and very rare bird.

item.description: Phoenix Spicer, who played 12 AFL matches for North Melbourne, has died at the age of 23.

item.title: How artificial intelligence is being used across the ACT to provide vital services
item.description: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

item.description: The Northern Territory's Top End has been transformed into a lush green paradise by a cyclone and a monsoon that have brought an unusually heavy start to the annual wet season.

item.description: Even in a world that has grown used to a cavalier attitude to international law from Donald Trump, the move stuns leaders across the globe.

item.title: Weary Australia eyes Ashes finish line at the SCG as England senses opportunity
item.description: Only the rain could slow England's progress on day one in Sydney, as a weary Australia reflected its coach's claims the series really ended in Adelaide.

item.title: Australian cricket great Damien Martyn awakes from induced coma after falling ill with meningitis
item.description: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

item.title: Thanasi Kokkinakis tears up and Nick Kyrgios chills out as Special Ks return at Brisbane International
item.description: Thanasi Kokkinakis said he didn't think he'd be able to return to tennis after a 2025 blighted by injury. Instead he's made a winning return alongside doubles partner and all-round showman Nick Kyrgios.

item.title: Cookbook Club Naarm is bringing strangers together over food

item.title: Repeated brain injuries linked to memory changes in intimate partner violence survivors, study finds
item.description: An Australian-first study finds evidence of previously undetected, long-term cognitive changes in women more than six months after they experienced repeated concussions and strangulation during intimate partner violence.

item.title: Value of Australian dollar now dependent on interest rates, commodities prices and geopolitics
item.description: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

item.description: International law is created by all states, not just the powerful few. This makes international community reactions to breaches particularly important.

item.title: National donor conception register would prevent 'potential trauma', advocate says
item.description: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

item.description: The Trump administration insists Venezuela's leaders will now comply with American demands after the extraordinary capture of president Nicolás Maduro — but his allies are resisting US pressure.

item.description: As widespread flooding maintains its grip on north-west Queensland, thousands of livestock are reported missing or dead.

item.description: A 25-year-old motorcyclist has died in a crash that forced the closure of city-bound lanes on Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway this morning.

item.title: Rufous scrub-bird DNA project aims to safeguard ancient and elusive songbird
item.description: The Rufous scrub-bird is one of the world's oldest surviving species of songbird, but scientists believe fewer than 2,000 of the birds remain.

item.title: Higher rate of eviction for community housing residents in WA as decision-making process questioned
item.description: Community housing is seen as a way for the government to tackle the housing crisis, but between limited options and court orders, some people are falling through the cracks.

item.title: What is developmental delay and how can you to tell if your child has one?
item.description: Developmental delay will be a big part of the new NDIS alternative for some kids. But what does the phrase mean and how can you tell if your child has one?

item.title: Is sustainable forestry certification protecting Australia's bushland?
item.description: Questions are being raised about sustainable timber certification in Australia.

item.title: Country league president reported to AFL integrity unit over alleged 'gender weirdness' comments
item.description: A country football league president has been reported to the AFL Integrity Unit over alleged comments about a club's "grooming and gender weirdness" after it was involved in blocking the club from entering a neighbouring competition.

item.title: Geraldton e-scooter contract with Beam Mobility up for renewal as crash victim urges people not to ride
item.description: Geraldton locals like Stuart Wise are calling for a crackdown on e-scooter safety, weeks after a man in his 30s died in an accident in the regional WA city.

item.title: Oil prices fall after US strikes on Venezuela, ASX flat
item.description: Australian shares have ended the session unchanged on Monday, while oil prices fall in a choppy trade following the US strike on Venezuela that sparked concerns about oversupply.

item.title: Ditching Sydney for a wheat header, French farmer travels 17,000km to pick up where dad left off
item.description: When 22-year-old Tanguy Bodiguel's friends said they were travelling to Australia, he left them in Sydney to work on a farm with sentimental value.

item.title: Ashes 2026 live updates: Australia 2-166, Travis Head 91* after Stokes-Labuschagne clash on day two of fifth Test at SCG
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne falls two runs short of a Test half-century, nicking off to Ben Stokes immediately after clashing with the England captain.

item.title: Novak Djokovic exits Professional Tennis Players Association ahead of Australian Open
item.description: Novak Djokovic is stepping away from the Professional Tennis Players Association citing concerns over transparency and governance within the organisation.

item.title: This toad busting group is determined to take back Magnetic Island
item.description: On a tropical Queensland island, 'toad busters' have decided the cane toad's spread across northern Australia should not be a lost cause.

item.title: South-East Asian powers offer strong criticism of US operation in Venezuela
item.description: Indonesia, Singapore and Malaysia express "grave concern" over the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Victorian Liberal Party deputy leader Sam Groth will exit politics at next election
item.description: Sam Groth, the deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party, has announced he will not contest the upcoming state election in November, saying he made his decision after realising that some recent negative public pressure had come from within his own party.

item.title: Tributes flow for founding father of Australian beef industry, Sir Graham McCamley
item.description: From building one of Queensland's most respected cattle empires and championing the Brahman breed, Sir Graham's lifelong dedication to agriculture and his community was truly remarkable.

item.title: Critics Choice Awards 2026 winners: One Battle After Another wins best picture
item.description: Now in their 31st year, the Critics Choice Awards are historically known to be the most accurate predictor of the Academy Award nominations.

item.description: In the wake of Zac Lomax's sudden departure, Parramatta makes a move in the player market as it looks to lifts its fortunes.

item.title: Jacob Elordi and Sarah Snook win at Critics Choice Awards
item.description: Australian actress Sarah Snook takes out Best Actress in a Limited Series or Movie Made for Television with All Her Fault while Australian Jacob Elordi takes out Best Supporting Actor for Frankenstein.

item.title: Measles alert as Adelaide and Sydney airports among possible exposure sites
item.description: SA and NSW health authorities have issued alerts about a potential measles exposure risk, after a person with the disease recently caught a flight from Adelaide to Sydney.

item.title: Trump's Venezuela move assumes his base will support his foreign interventions
item.description: Donald Trump has long defied political gravity but whether his followers in Congress and the MAGA movement will follow him into a new colonialism is a big gamble.

item.description: A 61-year-old dual national charged over a fatal hit-and-run in Darwin has been granted bail, less than 10 days after the crash which claimed the life of a 27-year-old woman.

item.description: Three shootings have occurred in northern Hobart in the space of a week, with police saying two appear to be related.

item.description: Easy weeknight meals were your favourite (again), with tray bakes, soups and noodles amongst the most loved.

item.description: In what has been a bowlers' series, the class of Joe Root and Travis Head again shone on day two in Sydney, where it often took something silly for a wicket to fall.

item.title: Queensland Police employee faces court over alleged antisemitic online posts
item.description: Muamer Nukic, a 50-year-old Queensland Police Service employee and described as a "self-proclaimed anti-Zionist" was granted bail in the Brisbane Magistrate Court on Monday.

item.title: Donald Trump claimed Venezuela stole US oil assets but the issue is more complicated than that
item.description: US President Donald Trump has said Venezuela stole United States oil assets. Experts say the truth is much more complex than that.

item.title: Former Labor politicians urge Albanese to call federal royal commission into antisemitism and Bondi attack
item.description: A group of former Labor MPs, senators and party officials have signed an open letter asking Anthony Albanese to call a national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Manchester United sacks head coach Ruben Amorim after turbulent tenure
item.description: It comes less than a day after the club drew one-all with Leeds United and a testy post-match press conference in which Amorim questioned his own role and the club's management.

item.description: Several defendants told the court their comments were intended as humour or satire.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann launches High Court appeal in latest defamation fight, alleging findings 'compromised'
item.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes his appeal to the High Court against the findings that he, on the balance of probabilities, raped Brittany Higgins in 2019.

item.description: Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores, who were captured in Caracas at the weekend, face multiple charges, including narco-terrorism.

item.title: How this new Melbourne suburb is dodging baking heat in summer
item.description: Thousands of young trees dot the streets and front gardens of this outer Melbourne suburb as part of a neighbourhood-wide push to create more shade and curb the urban heat island effect.

item.title: Nancy Kerrigan assault a soap-operatic story that overshadowed the 1994 Winter Olympics
item.description: The gentile and sequined world of figure skating had its dark side exposed in a drama worthy of a soap opera in 1994, as Nancy Kerrigan was the victim of a dastardly plot to eliminate her from the Winter Olympics.

item.description: In a world awash with oil, US President Donald Trump's takeover of Venezuela seems to be more about power than production.

item.description: The "most significant" heatwave south-eastern Australia has seen in six years is likely to trigger an extreme fire danger alongside searing hot temperatures.

item.title: UN chief Antonio Guterres warns of wider instability following US operation in Venezuela
item.description: The warning by the UN chief comes during an emergency session of the United Nations Security Council, just blocks from where Nicolás Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores are facing a Manhattan judge.

item.title: Tasmania's bioluminescence unrelated to salmon farm nutrients, scientist says
item.description: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

item.title: What to expect from Reserve Bank and interest rates in 2026 with rate hikes on the table
item.description: Mortgage borrowers and savers may have used the new year as an excuse to get their financial affairs in order, but things may be set to change within a matter of months.

item.title: Child abuse campaigners want reforms to Centrelink, insurance repayments from compensation
item.description: When survivors of child sexual abuse receive compensation, many may have to repay Centrelink, Medicare and private health insurance amounts relating to their abuse.

item.title: Walk while you work: Are the extra steps using an under-desk treadmill worth the cost?
item.description: Many people know what it feels like to sit at a computer all day, then sit on the living room couch all night. Would a desk treadmill help?

item.title: Woolwich Marina expansion rejected but locals worry about future
